In order to meet this need the NAEB, with the endorsement of the
ETRC, the JCET and the NCCET, proposed to the FAE that an educational
broadcasting placement service be established by the NAEB, Upon the
receipt of the first grant for this purpose, in 1954, the NAEB established
such a service, and the National Citizens Committee for Educational Tele¬
vision forwarded to the NAEB the files it had started, on a temporary basis*
The person employed as Placement Officer by the NAEB spent the first
several weeks on the job visiting other placement offices serving somewhat
similar areas in order to determine how such a service might be operated
most efficiently and effectively for a wholly new national need.
Additional time was spent establishing procedures and drawing up the
necessary forms. This early planning and preparation has paid off well in
the smooth operation of the Placement Service through succeeding years •
ETV stations, and those organizations and institutions planning stations,
were canvassed to determine their employee requirements. The men and
women in the former NCCET files were sent detailed questionnaires so that
up-to-date information, in readily usable form, would be on hand in the
placement files. Through notices in the NAEB Newsletter and letters to the
proper organizations and publications, the availability of this free service
was made known to the men and women seeking employment or personnel in
the educational broadcasting field.
